ARABIC: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَرِزْقُنَا مَا لَهُۥ مِن نَّفَادٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: This is Our provision which will never run out.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: This is surely Our provision never-ending.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This is Our provision for you, never to end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Our provision (for you) will never be exhausted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed this is Our sustenance, which will never end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (It will be said to them)! Verily, this is Our provision which will never finish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Most surely this is Our sustenance; it shall never come to an end;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: this is Our provision, unto which there is no end.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! this in truth is Our provision, which will never waste away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Our provision for you will never be exhausted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily this is Our provision: there will be no ceasing thereof.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: This is Our provision, which will never be exhausted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Truly such will be Our Bounty (to you); it will never fail;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (It will be said to them)! Verily, this is Our Provision which will never finish;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:54] This is indeed Our provision, which will never be exhausted’, in other words, one which will never cease (this [last] sentence [mā lahu min nafādin] is a circumstantial qualifier referring to rizqunā, ‘Our provision’; or it is a second predicate of inna, ‘indeed’, meaning that it will be ‘everlasting’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! this in truth is Our provision) this is the food and bliss We have for them, (which will never waste away) which will never cease or be interrupted.
